ai.summary: A 10.4 km moderate woodland hike through Broadford Community Woodland in the UK. The route follows forest paths at a steady pace, offering a peaceful nature experience with mostly gentle elevation and shaded sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Forest trails with packed earth and occasional gravel. Expect uneven surfaces, exposed roots and a few short climbs. Much of the track is shaded, with open clearings where views are possible.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for typical UK weather and shorter daylight hours in winter. Stay on marked paths and bring a map or GPS. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers. Carry water and snacks, and a small first-aid kit. Watch for muddy sections after rain, and take care on roots and wet leaves. Inform someone of your plans and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with spring and autumn offering the best balance of mild weather and scenery; summer provides long daylight hours; winter can be muddy and slippery.
